[Portrait]Master Darlavon
[Dialog]Now then, let us begin the lesson.

In this session, I shall explain how to change
the game options and what each option means.

You may use the options menu to change a
variety of game settings.

The options menu may be accessed both from
the world map and from the battlefield.

On the battlefield, press [Triangolo] in free cursor
mode to open the menu.

First, press [Simbolo B9] to close the battle menu and
enter free cursor mode.{END}

You are now in free cursor mode. In this
mode, you may freely move the cursor
using the directional buttons.
Now press [Triangolo] to open the menu, and
select "Options."{END}

This is the options menu.
Let us examine each option.

1. Cursor Movement lets you change
how the cursor moves on the battlefield.{END}

With Type A, pressing the up button
moves the cursor toward the upper
right.
With Type B, pressing the up button
moves the cursor toward the upper left.{END}

2. Cursor Repeat Rate controls how quickly
the cursor moves across the battlefield.{END}

3. Multi-height Toggle Rate controls how
quickly the cursor moves between two levels,
such as tiles on and below a bridge.{END}

Selecting "Off" will prevent the cursor from
moving automatically. Instead, you must press
START to switch levels.{END}

4. Menu Cursor Speed controls the speed
of the finger cursor when moving through
menus.{END}

5. Message Speed allows you to
adjust the display speed of dialogue
and system messages.{END}

6. Battle Prompts allows you to toggle
the display of messages during battle
that explain the game controls.{END}

7. Display Ability Names controls whether
ability and magick names are displayed when
they are used.{END}

8. Display Effect Messages controls whether
the effects of actions are displayed.{END}

9. Display Earned EXP/JP controls
whether experience and job points obtained
by units are displayed on-screen during battle.{END}

10. Target Colors controls whether enemies
and allies are highlighted in different
colors when selecting a target.
This makes it easier to distinguish between
allies and enemies.{END}

11. Display Unequippable Items affects which
items are displayed when equipping a unit.

If this is set to "Off," items that cannot be
equipped by a certain unit will not be included
in the item list for that unit.{END}

12. Optimize on Job Change affects the
items equipped on a unit when changing his
or her job or assigning new abilities.
When this option is turned on, the strongest
equipment will be automatically selected for a
unit when his or her job or abilities change.{END}

13. Sound controls whether sound effects
and music should be played in mono, stereo,
or surround modes.{END}

14. Restore Default Settings allows you
to restore all options to their default
values by selecting "Defaults."{END}

This concludes my explanation of the game
options.

Try to find the settings you like best to make
your gaming experience as comfortable as
possible.
With that, I shall bring this lesson to a close.{END}
